title: Berry Identification
description: Identify berries and small fruits from descriptions

questions.question: Which small, dark purple berry grows wild in forests across North America and Europe, stains fingers and lips, and is a key ingredient in many pies and jams?
Which red, heart-shaped fruit grows close to the ground on runners, has seeds on the outside of its skin, and is a symbol of Venus, the goddess of love?
Which tart, red berry grows in bogs and is traditionally served as a sauce alongside turkey at Thanksgiving dinner in the United States?
Which berry is made up of many small drupelets clustered together, is hollow when picked from the stem, and comes in red, black, and golden varieties?
Which dark, almost black berry grows on thorny canes, is larger than a raspberry, and stays attached to its white core when picked?
Which small, round berry grows in clusters on a tree, comes in red, white, and black varieties, and is used to make the French liqueur cassis?
Which small, dark berry grows in flat clusters on a shrub, must be cooked before eating, and is traditionally used to make wine and syrup?
Which tart, green berry has translucent skin with visible veins, grows on a thorny bush, and is popular in British desserts like 'fool' and crumbles?
Which small, bright red berry grows wild across Scandinavia, is closely related to the cranberry, and is served as a jam with Swedish meatballs?
Which berry looks similar to a blackberry, grows on a tree rather than a bush, and falls to the ground when ripe, often staining sidewalks purple?
Which small, dark blue berry is native to the Pacific Northwest, closely resembles a blueberry, and was a staple food for Native American tribes?
Which bright orange berry grows on thorny bushes, is extremely rich in vitamin C, and is used to make oils, juices, and supplements?
Which small, elongated red berry is native to China, is often sold dried, and has been marketed as a 'superfood' rich in antioxidants?
Which golden-orange berry grows in Arctic and subarctic regions, resembles a soft golden raspberry, and is considered a delicacy in Scandinavian countries?
Which small, round berry from the acai palm grows in the Amazon rainforest, has a deep purple color, and became a worldwide health food trend in smoothie bowls?
